headline: How Apple's Contrarian 'Nah, We're Good' Strategy Defies Amazon, Microsoft, Alphabet
summary: Apple Inc. (NASDAQ:AAPL) is the odd one out in Big Tech’s AI spending race. While the rest of the Magnificent 7 are collectively committing around $700 billion in capital expenditure (capex) over the next year, Apple cut its own spending 19% year-over-year last quarter to $2.37 billion. The chart, published by A16Z, captures the gap visually. Since 2014, Apple’s quarterly capex line has barely moved. Every other Big Tech line has turned parabolic. headline: Does Bath & Body Works' (BBWI) Disney Push and Dividend Signal a Refined Brand and Capital Strategy?
summary: Bath & Body Works, Inc. (NYSE: BBWI) recently declared a regular quarterly dividend of US$0.20 per share, payable on March 6, 2026, to shareholders of record on February 20, 2026, while also launching an expanded Disney Princess collection featuring 92 themed products across body care and home fragrance. This renewed Disney collaboration, adding characters like Aurora, Mulan, Rapunzel, and Snow White alongside updated fan favorites, highlights how licensing partnerships can deepen brand...

headline: AI Weekly: Pentagon warns Anthropic, Disney unhappy with Bytedance
summary: STORY: From the Pentagon warning Anthropic to Disney's Bytedance threat, this is AI Weekly.:: AI WeeklyThe Pentagon could end its relationship with Anthropic, according to a report in Axios.It's said to be unhappy with the AI firm's restrictions on how the U.S. military uses its models.The Pentagon wants the military to use Anthropic's tools for what it calls "all lawful purposes," including in weapons development and battlefield operations.But Axios said Claude maker Anthropic hasn't agreed to those terms and the Pentagon is getting fed up after months of negotiations.Bytedance will take steps to stop the unauthorized use of intellectual property on its new AI video generator.The Chinese firm made the announcement following legal threats from U.S. studios, including Disney.Seedance 2.0 was released last week and videos made on it have gone viral in China.But a source told Reuters Disney accused the Chinese firm of using its characters to train and power Seedance without permission.The AI Impact Summit kicked off in India to showcase the country's AI ambitions.India's Prime Minister Narendra Modi opened the event, attended by tech heavyweights like Google CEO Sundar Pichai and more.Indian leaders believe massive investments are coming to the country thanks to AI.India's IT minister Ashwini Vaishnaw spoke at the Impact summit. "So far, whatever investment commitments we have seen, it looks like in the coming two years, we should be seeing more than $200 billion worth investment across the five layers of AI stack."OpenAI warned U.S. lawmakers about the actions of Chinese AI startup DeepSeek.A memo seen by Reuters showed the Sam Altman-led firm believes DeepSeek has tried to replicate U.S. models and use them for their own training.The technique is known as distillation, where older AI models evaluate the quality of answers coming from a newer model - which effectively transfers the older version's learnings.DeepSeek and its parent company High-Flyer didn't respond to Reuters' requests for comment.And an Albanian actor is suing the country's government for using her image to play an AI character called 'Diella'.Anila Bisha said she never gave consent to be portrayed as one of the world's first AI-generated "virtual ministers” - and she wants $1 million in damages.Bisha says she allowed her likeness to be used last year to create an AI-powered virtual assistant for a government website, but not as a virtual politician on the prime minister’s team.The Albanian government has denied any wrongdoing.

raw.headline: AI Weekly: Pentagon warns Anthropic, Disney unhappy with Bytedance
raw.summary: STORY: From the Pentagon warning Anthropic to Disney's Bytedance threat, this is AI Weekly.:: AI WeeklyThe Pentagon could end its relationship with Anthropic, according to a report in Axios.It's said to be unhappy with the AI firm's restrictions on how the U.S. military uses its models.The Pentagon wants the military to use Anthropic's tools for what it calls "all lawful purposes," including in weapons development and battlefield operations.But Axios said Claude maker Anthropic hasn't agreed to those terms and the Pentagon is getting fed up after months of negotiations.Bytedance will take steps to stop the unauthorized use of intellectual property on its new AI video generator.The Chinese firm made the announcement following legal threats from U.S. studios, including Disney.Seedance 2.0 was released last week and videos made on it have gone viral in China.But a source told Reuters Disney accused the Chinese firm of using its characters to train and power Seedance without permission.The AI Impact Summit kicked off in India to showcase the country's AI ambitions.India's Prime Minister Narendra Modi opened the event, attended by tech heavyweights like Google CEO Sundar Pichai and more.Indian leaders believe massive investments are coming to the country thanks to AI.India's IT minister Ashwini Vaishnaw spoke at the Impact summit. "So far, whatever investment commitments we have seen, it looks like in the coming two years, we should be seeing more than $200 billion worth investment across the five layers of AI stack."OpenAI warned U.S. lawmakers about the actions of Chinese AI startup DeepSeek.A memo seen by Reuters showed the Sam Altman-led firm believes DeepSeek has tried to replicate U.S. models and use them for their own training.The technique is known as distillation, where older AI models evaluate the quality of answers coming from a newer model - which effectively transfers the older version's learnings.DeepSeek and its parent company High-Flyer didn't respond to Reuters' requests for comment.And an Albanian actor is suing the country's government for using her image to play an AI character called 'Diella'.Anila Bisha said she never gave consent to be portrayed as one of the world's first AI-generated "virtual ministers” - and she wants $1 million in damages.Bisha says she allowed her likeness to be used last year to create an AI-powered virtual assistant for a government website, but not as a virtual politician on the prime minister’s team.The Albanian government has denied any wrongdoing.

headline: Two Full-Time Jobs Are Becoming The New Normal For Nearly Half A Million Americans
summary: The number of Americans holding two full-time jobs reached 476,000, marking the second-highest level on record. The figure trails only December 2025’s all-time peak of 488,000. The trend represents a dramatic shift in the U.S. labor market, according to data shared by The Kobeissi Letter. Dual full-time employment has doubled since 2020, surpassing the dot-com bubble peak of 416,000 workers in July 2000. headline: Paramount's Motives Questioned By FCC Commissioner As Stephen Colbert Alleges CBS Prevented James Talarico From Appearing
summary: FCC Commissioner Anna Gomez accused Paramount Skydance of yielding to political pressure after Stephen Colbert said CBS blocked him from airing an interview with Texas Senate candidate James Talarico, raising concerns about First Amendment protections and potential FCC influence.
